p.codeblock: static bool PreloadWithUrl(const char* url, Error *err = nullptr)
public static void preloadWithUrl(String url) throws RteException

section.p: After successful preloading, opening the URL resource via can be faster, reducing wait time and improving the audio-visual experience.
Successfully preloading a resource can speed up opening the URL resource with , thereby reducing wait time.
section.note: This method currently only supports URLs starting with rte://. You can preload up to 20 URLs. If the limit is exceeded, the earliest preloaded URL will be replaced by the newly preloaded one.
This method currently only supports URLs prefixed with rte://. You can preload up to 20 URLs. If the limit is exceeded, the newly preloaded URL replaces the earliest one.

section.title: Scenario
section.p: Preloading before opening a media resource can reduce user wait time and provide a smoother audiovisual experience.

section.title: Timing
section.p: This method must be called before calling .
You must call this method before calling .

plentry.pd: Output parameter for status or error information. See .
A URL prefixed with rte://. For details of each field, see "Input Online Media Stream" on the audience side.

section.title: Exceptions
section.p: When the method call fails, the SDK throws an containing the corresponding error information. You need to catch and handle the exception.

section.title: Return Values
section.p:
Whether the preload succeeds:
: Preload succeeds.
: Preload fails.
